text: Andrew Byabashaija is a Ugandan lawyer and judge on the High Court of Uganda. He was appointed to that court by president Yoweri Museveni, on 17 June 2010. ==Background and education== He graduated from the Faculty of Law of Makerere University, Uganda's largest and oldest public university, with a Bachelor of Laws, circa 1986. The following year, he was awarded a Diploma in Legal Practice by the Law Development Centre, in Kampala, Uganda's capital city. He also holds a Master of Development Studies degree, also from Makerere University. His Doctor of Philosophy degree in business administration was obtained from the Washington International University, a distance education institution based in the British Virgin Islands. ==Career== Prior to his ascension to the bench, Bashaija was a senior partner in the law firm of Pearl Advocates & Solicitors. He also served as a senior lecturer at Kampala International University's School of Law and as an external examiner at the Law Development Centre. He was first appointed to the bench in 1992 as a Grade One Magistrate. Later, in 2000, he was promoted to the rank of Registrar. At the High Court, Justice Andrew Bashaija is the head of the land division. ==See also== *Monica Mugenyi *Jane Kiggundu *Ministry of Justice and Constitutional Affairs (Uganda) ==References== ==External links== *Website of the Judiciary of Uganda Category:Ugandan judges Category:Ugandan lawyers Category:1963 births Category:Living people Category:Makerere University alumni Category:Law Development Centre alumni Category:People from Western Region, Uganda Category:Justices of the High Court of Uganda Category:Law Development Centre academics Category:Kampala International University academics
title: Andrew Bashaija
